##"We survived, but love didn't. "

Micro Signal Zhenshigushi1

Feature description, a true story every day that touches the heart of the original.

Long distance at home is the easiest way for people in close relationships to see each other clearly. The basis of life heroism is to recognize the truth, but in the end, some people can not bear to bear the hatred, love again and again. We talked to some of our partners and saw what they went through during the outbreak, and what they saw in each other?
I had to share a room with my ex-boyfriend
Before the Spring Festival, my boyfriend drove me to the subway station, and I asked him, about our relationship, I need a clear answer.
The boyfriend said, don't we already have the answer in mind? And then he broke it off.
Before that, my boyfriend and I had a disagreement about whether to stay or go in Shanghai. He was three years older than me and wanted to go back to his hometown in Anhui Province. I had just graduated from school and started working in Shanghai. There was no decision at that time, finally, in the Spring Festival before the parting, we showdown.
My boyfriend's hometown is on the border between Anhui and Henan, which is the hardest hit area of the epidemic. Seeing the increasing number of confirmed cases there, I couldn't help but send a message asking him about his condition. The epidemic is so serious, I also told my boyfriend, "If we can get through this together, then there will be no more difficulties, right? " The boyfriend replied, "We've broken up, we can't get through this together. "
I'm sorry, my boyfriend is a reasonable man, he said, there is no way to take it back.
After returning to work, I was faced with the dilemma of going back to the rental house in Shanghai and continuing to live with my boyfriend in the same room. I asked the agent to show me the house. The other party replied that it was inconvenient during the epidemic, so I had to force my head back to the originally small house with my boyfriend. A week later, my boyfriend came back, home isolation period, my boyfriend and I rarely communicate with each other like strangers, he often play games alone all day.
I grew impatient with the situation, asking my boyfriend, have we moved on? Boyfriend said, still feelings, but not so much for me. Officially on the day of work, I was in low spirits, thinking after work do not go back, and angrily think, why risk their lives.
I didn't give up. I texted my boyfriend again to see if he still had feelings for me, and he said the same thing.
"Let's talk about it later, " I replied, hoping to turn the ending over to time.
Toto took a trip to Houx with her boyfriend
When I got back that night, I talked to my boyfriend as usual, and we cooked and ate together. He adjusted the way he and I used to get along, and he often pulled me to play games with him. For more than a month, we spent most of the time getting along, never talking about our differences again. We're supposed to be apart when this is over, but I don't want to think about it. I just want to enjoy the time I have with him.
Prescription

Long distance at home is the easiest way for people in close relationships to see each other clearly. The basis of life heroism is to recognize the truth, but in the end, some people can not bear to bear the hatred, love again and again. We talked to some of our partners and saw what they went through during the outbreak, and what they saw in each other?

Seeing the increasing number of confirmed cases there, I couldn't help but send a message asking him about his condition. The epidemic is so serious, I also told my boyfriend, "If we can get through this together, then there will be no more difficulties, right? " The boyfriend replied, "We've broken up, we can't get through this together. "
I'm sorry, my boyfriend is a reasonable man, he said, there is no way to take it back.

The other party replied that it was inconvenient during the epidemic, so I had to force my head back to the originally small house with my boyfriend. I didn't give up. I texted my boyfriend again to see if he still had feelings for me, and he said the same thing.
"Let's talk about it later, " I replied, hoping to turn the ending over to time.

For more than a month, we spent most of the time getting along, never talking about our differences again. We're supposed to be apart when this is over, but I don't want to think about it. I just want to enjoy the time I have with him.
Prescription

I had to share a room with my ex-boyfriend

Before the Spring Festival, my boyfriend drove me to the subway station, and I asked him, about our relationship, I need a clear answer.

The boyfriend said, don't we already have the answer in mind? And then he broke it off.

Before that, my boyfriend and I had a disagreement about whether to stay or go in Shanghai. He was three years older than me and wanted to go back to his hometown in Anhui Province. I had just graduated from school and started working in Shanghai. There was no decision at that time, finally, in the Spring Festival before the parting, we showdown.

My boyfriend's hometown is on the border between Anhui and Henan, which is the hardest hit area of the epidemic. Seeing the increasing number of confirmed cases there, I couldn't help but send a message asking him about his condition. The epidemic is so serious, I also told my boyfriend, "If we can get through this together, then there will be no more difficulties, right? " The boyfriend replied, "We've broken up, we can't get through this together. "

I'm sorry, my boyfriend is a reasonable man, he said, there is no way to take it back.

After returning to work, I was faced with the dilemma of going back to the rental house in Shanghai and continuing to live with my boyfriend in the same room. I asked the agent to show me the house. The other party replied that it was inconvenient during the epidemic, so I had to force my head back to the originally small house with my boyfriend. A week later, my boyfriend came back, home isolation period, my boyfriend and I rarely communicate with each other like strangers, he often play games alone all day.

I grew impatient with the situation, asking my boyfriend, have we moved on? Boyfriend said, still feelings, but not so much for me. Officially on the day of work, I was in low spirits, thinking after work do not go back, and angrily think, why risk their lives.

I didn't give up. I texted my boyfriend again to see if he still had feelings for me, and he said the same thing.

"Let's talk about it later, " I replied, hoping to turn the ending over to time.

Toto took a trip to Houx with her boyfriend

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
When I got back that night, I talked to my boyfriend as usual, and we cooked and ate together. He adjusted the way he and I used to get along, and he often pulled me to play games with him. For more than a month, we spent most of the time getting along, never talking about our differences again. We're supposed to be apart when this is over, but I don't want to think about it. I just want to enjoy the time I have with him.

Prescription

There are certain love patterns that a virus can't destroy
During the epidemic, my boyfriend was on a business trip in Japan, and a friend asked me to let him buy for me.
I replied, now that Haitao is so convenient, why bother him.
My friend joked that I was an example of an independent woman of our time, and that my relationship with my boyfriend was "as light as water" .
My boyfriend and I both worked in Beijing and dated for two years. At first, we lived together like any other couple, but we soon discovered that our lives were different and that we often got into fights over little things like each other sleeping late. Our work and family worries weighed us down. Gradually, we decided to live apart and share only our happy moments with each other.
Every week, we'd get in touch in advance and set up a date for dinner, a movie, or a walk or an exhibition. We all enjoy a relaxed relationship. When the outbreak started, I was worried that our uncommitted love would be destroyed by the quarantine.
When my boyfriend was in Japan, we had very little contact, did not call, only when interesting things happened, to share with each other on Wechat, sometimes my boyfriend came back very late, I do not care. When I was in college, I once had a painful foreign love affair. Two people living in different environments and cultures, in order to make conversation, asked each other what they had eaten and what the weather was like, the next day's chat can be completely copied from the previous day. I don't want to have that kind of relationship and conversation.
When I learned about the outbreak years ago, I rode my motorcycle around Beijing for half a day and finally bought a mask in a medical equipment company. I texted my boyfriend to ask if I needed to prepare some for him. Boyfriend replied, no, just take care of yourself.
A thought crossed my mind, wondering if he was being unkind, and thinking, that's just the way boyfriends are. When my parents came to stay with me during the home quarantine, my father and I would often quarrel over trivial matters. I couldn't stand the argument. I was convinced that living independently from my boyfriend was the right thing to do. Our relationship didn't end like this.
That night when it snowed in Beijing, my friend and I talked about my love and said that our relationship was different from others, "like the sunset red. ". My friends were joking, but I couldn't sleep, and after a lot of thinking, I made sure that I felt comfortable in the relationship, that it didn't bother me, and that I believed it would work.
On March 1st, my boyfriend returned to China. The next day, I took off work from home and rode my motorcycle to deliver supplies to my boyfriend. We all lived along the North Third Ring Road, only 20 minutes by bike. Over the fence, I handed my boyfriend a bag of face masks and an old kinect game from Japan. After coming back I have been working, my boyfriend asked me how many times to play, I said in overtime, boyfriend reply, you busy you, never mind me, but you bought bread really good, have taste!
The food truck for your boyfriend
After this outbreak, I've confirmed that this relationship, which may seem strange to others, is for us. I have always believed that the more independent the body, the closer the mind, even in love, everyone should have their own independent space.
Sledgehammer

There are certain love patterns that a virus can't destroy

During the epidemic, my boyfriend was on a business trip in Japan, and a friend asked me to let him buy for me.

I replied, now that Haitao is so convenient, why bother him.

My friend joked that I was an example of an independent woman of our time, and that my relationship with my boyfriend was "as light as water" .

My boyfriend and I both worked in Beijing and dated for two years. At first, we lived together like any other couple, but we soon discovered that our lives were different and that we often got into fights over little things like each other sleeping late. Our work and family worries weighed us down. Gradually, we decided to live apart and share only our happy moments with each other.

Every week, we'd get in touch in advance and set up a date for dinner, a movie, or a walk or an exhibition. We all enjoy a relaxed relationship. When the outbreak started, I was worried that our uncommitted love would be destroyed by the quarantine.

When my boyfriend was in Japan, we had very little contact, did not call, only when interesting things happened, to share with each other on Wechat, sometimes my boyfriend came back very late, I do not care. When I was in college, I once had a painful foreign love affair. Two people living in different environments and cultures, in order to make conversation, asked each other what they had eaten and what the weather was like, the next day's chat can be completely copied from the previous day. I don't want to have that kind of relationship and conversation.

When I learned about the outbreak years ago, I rode my motorcycle around Beijing for half a day and finally bought a mask in a medical equipment company. I texted my boyfriend to ask if I needed to prepare some for him. Boyfriend replied, no, just take care of yourself.

A thought crossed my mind, wondering if he was being unkind, and thinking, that's just the way boyfriends are. When my parents came to stay with me during the home quarantine, my father and I would often quarrel over trivial matters. I couldn't stand the argument. I was convinced that living independently from my boyfriend was the right thing to do. Our relationship didn't end like this.

That night when it snowed in Beijing, my friend and I talked about my love and said that our relationship was different from others, "like the sunset red. ". My friends were joking, but I couldn't sleep, and after a lot of thinking, I made sure that I felt comfortable in the relationship, that it didn't bother me, and that I believed it would work.

On March 1st, my boyfriend returned to China. The next day, I took off work from home and rode my motorcycle to deliver supplies to my boyfriend. We all lived along the North Third Ring Road, only 20 minutes by bike. Over the fence, I handed my boyfriend a bag of face masks and an old kinect game from Japan. After coming back I have been working, my boyfriend asked me how many times to play, I said in overtime, boyfriend reply, you busy you, never mind me, but you bought bread really good, have taste!

The food truck for your boyfriend

After this outbreak, I've confirmed that this relationship, which may seem strange to others, is for us. I have always believed that the more independent the body, the closer the mind, even in love, everyone should have their own independent space.

Sledgehammer

It's an epidemic. Two depressed people break up
I advised him to go to dinner, the boyfriend replied, never mind, not want to move. And I can't talk him out of it. I've said the same thing so many times.
My boyfriend, who is 20 years older than me, is also suffering from depression. We met on the "walking rice" micro blog of a former suicide sufferer. For a while, I used to go to the "walking rice" micro blog to record my feelings, i left my contact information, eager to make friends in my situation. In this way, my boyfriend added me, after a period of time, he pursued me, has been longing for love, I quickly agreed to accompany. At first, we were very close. We talked on the phone for a long time every day. Sometimes we woke up in the morning and the phone was still on.
School winter vacation, after returning home, my boyfriend and I suddenly less contact up. My mother is afraid I because of lovelorn suicide, so opposed to my love in college, and home a room a hall, no other room, all day with her mother, even to the boyfriend is not convenient.
As the outbreak progressed, more and more negative messages were posted on microblogs, and patients shared them with me or shared their conflicts with their families and lovers during their isolation. I am very easy to be infected by other people's emotions, but also hard to open and enlightened others, I am more and more anxious, tired. Years later, I began to take online classes, except for class is immersed in mobile games, in order to escape the pain, occasionally find my boyfriend chat me, I feel restless.
I thought when the epidemic was over, everything would be back to normal, including my boyfriend. But my boyfriend because of my alienation, become worried about loss, he kept sending me messages, asking me whether he did not good enough, whether I disappointed. My boyfriend and my ex-girlfriend broke up during SARS, and I haven't been in a relationship for more than a decade, and I know that my actions have made him pessimistic about our relationship.
But I am also in the emotional whirlpool of self-occupied, want to shrink in their own world, escape can not cope with the life and suffering, do not know how and boyfriend again to communicate.
One night, I was watching TV with my mother, the phone rang, I picked up the phone found that my boyfriend has made more than a dozen calls, I was afraid to press the phone to arouse my mother's suspicion, had to answer the phone, later, I and my boyfriend in a big fight on wechat. I felt more and more powerless in my relationship with my boyfriend, and finally, we broke up.
Photos | conversations with boyfriends
The other day, I told a friend that if I ever wanted to fall in love again, I would have to be dissuaded. Until my depression is gone, I find it hard to love anyone.
Green

It's an epidemic. Two depressed people break up

I advised him to go to dinner, the boyfriend replied, never mind, not want to move. And I can't talk him out of it. I've said the same thing so many times.

I felt more and more powerless in my relationship with my boyfriend, and finally, we broke up.

Photos | conversations with boyfriends

The other day, I told a friend that if I ever wanted to fall in love again, I would have to be dissuaded. Until my depression is gone, I find it hard to love anyone.

Green

A brief revival of widowed parenting
My son is a year and a half old and very clingy. Sometimes when I go to the toilet and close the door, he climbs outside and bangs on the door and cries. He doesn't pay attention when he eats, he eats slowly, and he can often be fed for an hour at a time, for a while.
My boyfriend and I had been dating for five years before we got married. I sensed early on that he wasn't a typical responsible man, but one detail led me to believe that my boyfriend would love and protect me in the big moments: In College, my father came to visit me at school, and I formally introduced my boyfriend to my father, the three of US went out to dinner. During the meal, I heard a noise outside, someone shouted to gas explosion, my father ran out, did not even take the bag, and my boyfriend calmly took my arm, picked up his bag, took me out of the restaurant.
In 2018, after two years of marriage, we had a child of our own. My husband didn't become a family man, he was a salesman, and he would go out after work, and at the height of his madness, he would come home at two or three in the morning, sleep into the middle of the day, and then go back to work, with no weekends and little time for me and the kids. The hard, broken moments of parenting were mine to bear alone. I have questioned my husband, why colleagues birthday so do not have to go to dinner also to participate, her husband said each other stingy, not good. I'm beginning to think my husband just likes to hang out and doesn't want to take responsibility for the family.
I doubt if he'd make a good father. Shortly after the birth of my child, the combination of postpartum depression and the absence of my husband made me want a divorce and even began to plan the details of the division of property. Every week I have an argument with my husband, who is a good-natured man who wheedles me and buys me presents, and my anger is like hitting cotton.
Before the Spring Festival holiday in 2020, I heard the news of the epidemic early, bought a lot of masks, disinfectant, and advised my parents not to go out for the New Year, go out with a good mask, come back to pay attention to disinfection, father did not listen to me, and Berated me for worrying, and we got in a huge fight about it.
When my husband came home that night and heard me say it, he said calmly, let me talk to my dad. After a short while, the husband came back, I do not know what he did, father actually agreed to listen to us. Years later, Sichuan has been confirmed new cases, the community closed, always out of the entertainment of the husband suddenly forced to stay at home.
Maybe it was the first time I really saw how hard it was for me to raise my kids, and my husband began to make some changes, helping me with the housework and the kids. He used to sleep late on holidays, this period of time, a call him up, to mix milk for the child, wash the bottom, I take the child, he will cook. Husbands also like to play with their sons, and I recall being surprised to learn from his colleagues how often he brags about how cute he is in the office.
Children watch their father cook
More than a month of isolation period, let me feel, as long as there is time, my husband also has the patience to accompany us, can be a good father. We used to sleep back to back or in separate beds, but now I allow my husband to cuddle me when he wants to.
After the resumption of work, my husband's company to work in batches, he is not busy, after work, and during the same period of isolation to take care of our mother and son. I don't know if I'm going back to widowhood parenting after the epidemic.
Peaches. Peaches

A brief revival of widowed parenting

My son is a year and a half old and very clingy. Sometimes when I go to the toilet and close the door, he climbs outside and bangs on the door and cries. He doesn't pay attention when he eats, he eats slowly, and he can often be fed for an hour at a time, for a while.

My boyfriend and I had been dating for five years before we got married. I sensed early on that he wasn't a typical responsible man, but one detail led me to believe that my boyfriend would love and protect me in the big moments: In College, my father came to visit me at school, and I formally introduced my boyfriend to my father, the three of US went out to dinner. During the meal, I heard a noise outside, someone shouted to gas explosion, my father ran out, did not even take the bag, and my boyfriend calmly took my arm, picked up his bag, took me out of the restaurant.

In 2018, after two years of marriage, we had a child of our own. My husband didn't become a family man, he was a salesman, and he would go out after work, and at the height of his madness, he would come home at two or three in the morning, sleep into the middle of the day, and then go back to work, with no weekends and little time for me and the kids. The hard, broken moments of parenting were mine to bear alone. I have questioned my husband, why colleagues birthday so do not have to go to dinner also to participate, her husband said each other stingy, not good. I'm beginning to think my husband just likes to hang out and doesn't want to take responsibility for the family.

I doubt if he'd make a good father. Shortly after the birth of my child, the combination of postpartum depression and the absence of my husband made me want a divorce and even began to plan the details of the division of property. Every week I have an argument with my husband, who is a good-natured man who wheedles me and buys me presents, and my anger is like hitting cotton.

Before the Spring Festival holiday in 2020, I heard the news of the epidemic early, bought a lot of masks, disinfectant, and advised my parents not to go out for the New Year, go out with a good mask, come back to pay attention to disinfection, father did not listen to me, and Berated me for worrying, and we got in a huge fight about it.

When my husband came home that night and heard me say it, he said calmly, let me talk to my dad. After a short while, the husband came back, I do not know what he did, father actually agreed to listen to us. Years later, Sichuan has been confirmed new cases, the community closed, always out of the entertainment of the husband suddenly forced to stay at home.

Maybe it was the first time I really saw how hard it was for me to raise my kids, and my husband began to make some changes, helping me with the housework and the kids. He used to sleep late on holidays, this period of time, a call him up, to mix milk for the child, wash the bottom, I take the child, he will cook. Husbands also like to play with their sons, and I recall being surprised to learn from his colleagues how often he brags about how cute he is in the office.

Children watch their father cook

More than a month of isolation period, let me feel, as long as there is time, my husband also has the patience to accompany us, can be a good father. We used to sleep back to back or in separate beds, but now I allow my husband to cuddle me when he wants to.

After the resumption of work, my husband's company to work in batches, he is not busy, after work, and during the same period of isolation to take care of our mother and son. I don't know if I'm going back to widowhood parenting after the epidemic.

Peaches. Peaches

After ten years of marriage, my husband found out he couldn't live without us
After the marriage, in order to earn more money to ease the pressure on the family, the husband worked in the wind and the sun, step by step from welder to a large state-owned contractor in Yantai Project Manager, usually living in Yantai. My husband takes care of the family and calls me as soon as his monthly salary is paid. Every night after dinner, he and I have a video chat with my daughter.
My husband uses his spare time to study hard. I also work part-time as an accountant for several companies. Life is not easy. We often cheer each other up on the phone. My husband has always been the pillar of the family, buying a house and a car, are the husband's decision, I also used to rely on him.
This Spring Festival, my husband didn't come home because he had more than 10,000 yuan to stay on duty at work. I took my ten-year-old daughter, my seven-month-old daughter and my mother-in-law to Yantai to spend the New Year with him for the first time, the epidemic seems so far away. When I heard we were coming, my husband killed four chickens in advance and put them in the refrigerator. On the first day of the New Year, he cooked for us, following the example of the food blogger on the short video.
My husband's cooking
We stayed in Yantai for more than 20 days because of the closure of the neighborhood and the road. The family had not been together for such a long time.
Every day, my mother-in-law and I cooked a meal, waiting for my husband to come back from duty to eat together. In his spare time, my husband often asked me what I wanted to eat, I said a dish name, he went online research, play to do it, see the Internet to do cool skin, my husband also learned to do for us, busy all morning kneading. The husband's dormitory does not have the television, fears us to be bored, he borrows the projector from the unit, every evening connects the notebook computer, accompanies the child to watch the cartoon, to watch the movie.
On the 16th of January, fearing we'd caught the virus on the high-speed train, my husband drove more than 500 kilometers and sent us back to Tai'an.
A few days ago, my husband may have had a few drinks. He sent me a message on Wechat, saying that after work, he looked at The Empty Family and realized that he thought we couldn't leave him, but he couldn't leave us. He saved up the bonus, salary, subsidies and sent me, said Save, work hard, and buy a second house, but this time, he let me choose their own.
Bian Xiaochun

Bian Xiaochun
